com.sana.android.plugin.application

Class CaptureManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sana.android.plugin.application.CaptureManager

  • public class CaptureManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The main helper class that facilitates data capturing from various sensing devices.
    Author:
    Han Lin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CaptureManager(Feature source, MimeType type) 
      CaptureManager(Feature source, MimeType type, CaptureSetting setting)
      Create a CaptureManager that receives data of the specified MIME type and from the given Feature.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaptureManager

        public CaptureManager(Feature source,
                      MimeType type)

      • CaptureManager

        public CaptureManager(Feature source,
                      MimeType type,
                      CaptureSetting setting)
        Create a CaptureManager that receives data of the specified MIME type and from the given Feature. The
        Parameters:
        source - The device feature from which data will come from.
        type - The MIME type of the data intended to be captured.
        setting - The setting to be passed to the sensor.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(DataListener listener)
        Add a listener to the sensing device. Call this method if you wish to receive updates from the device. You can extend the existing DataChunkListener or TimedListener. The listening configuration can be modified in those classes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener instance that is intended to receive updates.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(DataListener listener)
        Remove the listener. A listener may be added multiple times. This method will remove all of them.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • prepare

        public void prepare()
        Prepare the sensing device for data capture. This method has to be called before calling the begin method. If before calling this method there has been another recording activity, the reset method must be called prior to this method. Otherwise an InvalidInvocationError will be thrown.

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Start sensing activity. If prepare is not called before calling this, an InvalidInvocationError will be thrown.

      • stop

        public DataWithEvent stop()
        Unlike prepare and begin. stop can be called anytime. However if there was no sensing activity before this, null will be returned.
        Returns:
        The data object that contains information of sensing result. Or null if no sensing activity has been initiated.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Unlike prepare and begin. reset can be called anytime. It simply reset the sensing device to the default state.
